t: Job 19
Job
Then*p Job replied:
“How*pn long will you torment me and*ld crush me with words?
Ten*ln times now you have reproached me; shamelessly*ld you attack me.
If*ln it is true that I have gone astray, my*ld error remains my concern alone.
If*ln indeed you would exalt yourselves above me and*ld use my humiliation against me,
then*ln know that God has wronged me and*ld drawn his net around me.
“Though*pn I cry, ‘Violence!’ I get no response; though*ld I call for help, there is no justice.
He*ln has blocked my way so I cannot pass; he*ld has shrouded my paths in darkness.
He*ln has stripped me of my honor and*ld removed the crown from my head.
He*ln tears me down on every side till I am gone; he*ld uproots my hope like a tree.
His*ln anger burns against me; he*ld counts me among his enemies.
His*ln troops advance in force; they*ld build a siege ramp against me and*ld encamp around my tent.
“He*pn has alienated my family from me; my*ld acquaintances are completely estranged from me.
My*ln relatives have gone away; my*ld closest friends have forgotten me.
My*ln guests and my female servants count me a foreigner; they*ld look on me as on a stranger.
I*ln summon my servant, but he does not answer, though*ld I beg him with my own mouth.
My*ln breath is offensive to my wife; I*ld am loathsome to my own family.
Even*ln the little boys scorn me; when*ld I appear, they ridicule me.
All*ln my intimate friends detest me; those*ld I love have turned against me.
I*ln am nothing but skin and bones; I*ld have escaped only by the skin of my teeth.
“Have*pn pity on me, my friends, have pity, for*ld the hand of God has struck me.
Why*ln do you pursue me as God does? Will*ld you never get enough of my flesh?
“Oh,*pn that my words were recorded, that*ld they were written on a scroll,
that*ln they were inscribed with an iron tool on lead, or*ld engraved in rock forever!
I*ln know that my redeemer lives, and*ld that in the end he will stand on the earth.
And*ln after my skin has been destroyed, yet*ld in my flesh I will see God;
I*ln myself will see him with*ld my own eyes—I, and not another. How*ld my heart yearns within me!
“If*pn you say, ‘How we will hound him, since*ld the root of the trouble lies in him,’
you*ln should fear the sword yourselves; for*ld wrath will bring punishment by the sword, and*ld then you will know that there is judgment.”
